[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: native_equality] [Semantic Gap] Can disabling native_equality while using extensional vector theories create unsoundness where array equality semantics differ between verification and execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: vector_using_sequences] [Theory Incompatibility] Can enabling vector_using_sequences with incompatible vector_theory settings cause verification to accept invalid contracts due to semantic mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Constant: DEFAULT_BOOGIE_FLAGS] [Flag Manipulation] Can an attacker exploit the hardcoded flags like '-printModel:1' and '-enhancedErrorMessages:1' to extract sensitive information from verification models? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: aggressive_func_inline] [Verification Timeout] Can setting aggressive_func_inline to empty string disable function inlining, causing verification timeout and allowing unverified contracts to deploy? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: func_inline] [Performance Attack] Can an attacker manipulate func_inline attribute to force excessive inlining, causing verification to timeout and bypass safety checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: num_instances] [Race Condition] Can multiple concurrent Boogie instances create race conditions when writing to shared log files or temporary files, corrupting verification results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: sequential_task] [Race Condition] When sequential_task is false, can concurrent verification tasks access shared BoogieOptions state causing race conditions in option modification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: proc_cores] [Race Condition] Can parallel processing with multiple proc_cores cause non-deterministic verification results due to race conditions in shared state access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: shards] [Race Condition] Can concurrent execution of multiple shards create race conditions when accessing shared verification state or writing results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_log_file()] [TOCTOU] Can there be a time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability where the log file path is validated but then modified before writing, causing security issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: keep_artifacts] [Information Disclosure] Can enabling keep_artifacts leak sensitive verification intermediate files containing internal Move contract logic or prover state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: generate_smt] [Information Disclosure] Does generate_smt expose sensitive SMT-LIB files that could reveal contract logic or help attackers craft verification bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: z3_trace_file] [Path Traversal] Can an attacker use path traversal in z3_trace_file to write trace files to arbitrary filesystem locations, potentially overwriting critical files? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_log_file()] [File Overwrite] Can an attacker cause log file collision by crafting boogie_file names that resolve to the same log file path, corrupting verification logs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: debug_trace] [Debug Information Leak] Can enabling debug_trace expose sensitive internal state or verification logic that helps attackers understand verification weaknesses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: use_cvc5] [Solver Inconsistency] Can switching between Z3 and CVC5 solvers cause verification inconsistencies where contracts verified by one solver fail under the other due to different decision procedures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Solver Flag Injection] Can an attacker inject malicious prover options through the -proverOpt flags to modify SMT solver behavior and bypass verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Array Theory Bypass] Can an attacker manipulate smt.array.extensional flag to disable array extensionality checking, allowing array equality bugs to pass verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Quantifier Attack] Can an attacker manipulate QI.EAGER_THRESHOLD and QI.LAZY_THRESHOLD to force incomplete quantifier instantiation, missing critical verification conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Function: get_boogie_command()] [Model Validation Bypass] Can an attacker disable model_validate=true in prover options to skip model validation, allowing inconsistent verification models? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: vc_timeout] [Timeout Bypass] Can an attacker set vc_timeout to 0 or usize::MAX to disable verification timeouts, allowing arbitrarily long verification times that block the system? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/boogie-backend/src/options.rs] [Field: global_timeout_overwrite] [Timeout Confusion] Can disabling global_timeout_overwrite allow local timeout specifications to override critical global timeout limits, enabling verification bypass? (Medium)
